description: a(n) = 1 + coefficient of x^n in Product_{k>=1} (1-x^k) (essentially the expansion of the Dedekind function eta(x)).
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 825.
B. Schoeneberg, Elliptic Modular Functions, Springer-Verlag, NY, 1974, p. 70.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 825.
formula: eta(z) = q^(1/24) Product_{m>=1} (1-q^m), q=exp(2 Pi i z).G.f.: 1/(1-x) + Product_{k>0} (1-x^k). - _Michael Somos_, Jun 26 2004
mathematica: p[n_] := p[n] = Expand[p[n-1]*(1-x^n)]; p[1] = 1-x; a[n_] := 1+Coefficient[p[n], x^n]; a[0] = 2; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 104}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2012 *)1 + CoefficientList[QPochhammer[q] + O[q]^120, q] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 24 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 19 1994
